importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the incident and death were reported to the public.
The date of Doug Martin’s NFL draft selection (31st overall in the first round), marking the beginning of his professional football career.
The date of Martin’s second Pro Bowl selection, reflecting a significant milestone in his career.
The date of Martin’s first-team All-Pro recognition in 2015, highlighting his performance during that season.
The date of his 2015 season performance (1,402 yards and 6 TDs), which contributed to his Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Martin’s peak NFL career years, during which he achieved major accolades and performance milestones.
The span of his NFL career, encompassing six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during a break-in investigation in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
He was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
Martin finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, including 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history during the team’s 50th anniversary celebration.
The incident sparked public concern about police interactions with former athletes and potential risks during detentions.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, emphasizing the loss of a community figure and athlete.
An autopsy has been ordered to determine the cause of death, which remains officially undisclosed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a 31st overall draft pick in 2012 and a standout player with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland police during a break-in investigation. The incident, which occurred on Saturday, raised concerns about police interactions with athletes and the risks of detention. Martin had a successful career, rushing for over 5,300 yards and 30 touchdowns, and was honored as one of the franchise’s top 50 players. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, and an autopsy has been conducted to determine the cause of death. The event highlights the intersection of public safety, athlete well-being, and community sentiment.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation
